Description: Typical range for 1064 nm Nd:YAG lasers in polymer composite cleaning to balance ablation efficiency and heat input; starting at 100 W minimizes thermal damage to epoxy matrix. Max safe ~300 W to avoid delamination (based on thermal conductivity ~0.2-0.5 W/mK). Source: Studies in Optics and Lasers in Engineering (2018) on laser ablation of CFRP; IPG Photonics YLR series specs.
Near-IR wavelength providing good absorption in epoxy resins with minimal substrate penetration
Beam spot diameter for precise epoxy removal control
High repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of epoxy matrix
Optimal scanning speed for uniform epoxy removal
Number of cleaning passes for complete epoxy removal
Beam overlap percentage for uniform cleaning coverage
